result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason P. Rezarch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:

AODA and follow through with recommendations.

supervisions.notes:
If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. 

22CM208 was ordered dismissed and read in
Concurrent with: any other sentence

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jason P. Rezarch

records.addlTxt:
Restitution Ordered in the amount of $1,814.33
Plus 10% Restitution Surcharge

11:22 AM Cases called: 22CF296, 22CF303 & 22CM208. Defendant Jason P. Rezarch appeared by telephone, in custody from Dodge Correctional Institution.  Attorney Melissa M. Petersen in court for Jason P. Rezarch.  Attorney Peter J. Rindal in court for State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waives his right to appear in person for this hearing.
Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing in 22CF296 & 22CF303 and Court accepts waiver. 
There is an agreement. Victim/Witness statute complied with. 

Defendant enters a no contest plea to Count 1 in 22CF296 Possess with Intent to Deliver Methamphetamine, Second and Subsequent and as a Repeater.  
Defendant enters a no contest plea to Count 1 in 22CF303: Felony Retail Theft as a Repeater. 

Priors as related to the charges are acknowledged. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Court accepts plea and finds the defendant guilty. Defendant makes statement to Court. 

Court orders: 
22CF296 Count 1: 2.5 years Initial Confinement with 5 years of Extended Supervision concurrent to any other sentence
22CF303 Count 1: 2.5 years Initial Confinement with 2 years of Extended Supervision concurrent to any other sentence

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
AODA and follow through with recommendations. 
Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol is primarily served/sold. 
Defendant not to consume/use/possess any illegal drugs/non-prescribed medications/controlled substances or drug paraphernalia. 
No contact with Jade Perrin,
No contact with Woodman's or Fleet Farm any locations,
No contact with any known drug dealers/users except in a therapeutic setting. 
Restitution in the amount of $1,780.10 in 22CF303 and $34.23 from case 22CM208, plus the 10% surcharge. 
court costs,
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge. 

Anything else is ordered dismissed and read in. Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program but not the Challenge Incarceration Program. State indicates that personal property can be picked up from the property room. Defendant has designated Kendra Hatleli to pick up property from property room after the 20 day appeal time has run out.

Jail credit: 
22CF296 = 66 days 
22CF303 = 66 days
Plea hearing on June 7, 2022 at 11:00 am.

9:42 AM cases 22CF296, 22CM208, 22CF303 called. Prosecuting attorney Andrew James Gunderson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jason P. Rezarch in court, in custody.  Attorney Melissa M. Petersen in court for Jason P. Rezarch. 
Defense is still considering the offer from the State and Defense asks for one more return.
Hearing scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Conditions:
No contact with Woodman's Stores or J.P. (co-defendant).
No contact with anyone involved in illegal drug activities.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
(Covers 22CF296, 22CM208, 22CF303)
(Refused to Sign)

(Cases called 22CF296, 22CM208, 22CF303 at 11:34 am.)  Court Commissioner Nathan Novak for Branch 2
Defendant Jason Rezarch appeared in custody with Attorney Karl Schmidt from Eau Claire Jail.  State by Afton Lewis ADA
Defendant advised of charges and potential penalties/waives reading of the complaint.  On probation hold.  Time limits for preliminary hearing waived.
Pretrial Conference:  03-28-22 at 2 pm.  Hearing:  04-21-22 at 9:30 am.
